title: Listing fonts by cast emotion
content:
has anyone listed fonts by their ability to express particular emotions/feelings/atmosphere i.e.without additional work etc?

could be an interesting learning tool.

if not ... it's my idea I need royalties. © 2006. ™

:)
author: Ratbaggy

comments.content:
Lintype's old stand-alone CD application [FontExplorer](http://web.archive.org/web/20150323184418/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontExplorer) ( **NOT** to be confused with the new—and free—font manager FontExplorer X) can sort Linotype fonts by subjective criteria, including some emotions.

Please contact me offline (over my profile) if I can help any more with this.

There may be some other tools available as well. I think that FontShop San Francisco might have something online that can do this, but I'm not so familiar with their offerings.

Welcome with Flowers:  
 [http://www.crAUSwords.com/flowers/WFlowers.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150323184418/http:/www.crauswords.com/flowers/WFlowers.htm "http://www.crAUSwords.com/flowers/WFlowers.htm")  
Hope you will get what you are after here:  
 [http://www.dafont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150323184418/http:/www.dafont.com/ "http://www.dafont.com")  
Happy Exploring

I haven't heard much lately on the [Universal Font Classification System (UFCS)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150323184418/http:/www.type-expertise.com/overview.htm) described at Type-Expertise.com.

I wonder if Denis Ravizza is still pushing the project.

Hello Norbert Florendo,

Yes I am still pushing it, and I am glad you still remember Type-Expertise since your last post about it on this forum in november 2005 :-)

I am in the application developement stage, which takes time and money as me and the people who beleive in this concept are doing it without financial support, but we'll get there ! and I will let you know.

Regards  
Denis Ravizza
